intro: Symphyotrichum spathulatum var. spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf ironweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and clusters of purple to pinkish-pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open woods and prairies. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
